metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5168 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Skia, as used in Google Chrome before 50.0.2661.94, allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352').
